org.json

Class JSONWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.json.JSONWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSONStringer

    public class JSONWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    JSONWriter provides a quick and convenient way of producing JSON text. The texts produced strictly conform to JSON syntax rules. No whitespace is added, so the results are ready for transmission or storage. Each instance of JSONWriter can produce one JSON text.

    A JSONWriter instance provides a value method for appending values to the text, and a key method for adding keys before values in objects. There are array and endArray methods that make and bound array values, and object and endObject methods which make and bound object values. All of these methods return the JSONWriter instance, permitting a cascade style. For example, 

     new JSONWriter(myWriter)
     .object()
         .key("JSON")
         .value("Hello, World!")
     .endObject();
    which writes 
     {"JSON":"Hello, World!"}

    The first method called must be array or object. There are no methods for adding commas or colons. JSONWriter adds them for you. Objects and arrays can be nested arbitrarily deep.

    This can sometimes be easier than using a JSONObject to build a string.

    • Field Detail

      • mode

        protected char mode
        The current mode. Values: 'a' (array), 'd' (done), 'i' (initial), 'k' (key), 'o' (object).

      • writer

        protected final java.lang.Appendable writer
        The writer that will receive the output.

    • Method Detail

      • array

        public JSONWriter array()
                 throws JSONException
        Begin appending a new array. All values until the balancing endArray will be appended to this array. The endArray method must be called to mark the array's end.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If the nesting is too deep, or if the object is started in the wrong place (for example as a key or after the end of the outermost array or object).

      • endArray

        public JSONWriter endArray()
                    throws JSONException
        End an array. This method most be called to balance calls to array.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If incorrectly nested.

                     throws JSONException

        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If incorrectly nested.

      • key

        public JSONWriter key(java.lang.String string)
               throws JSONException
        Append a key. The key will be associated with the next value. In an object, every value must be preceded by a key.
        Parameters:
        string - A key string.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If the key is out of place. For example, keys do not belong in arrays or if the key is null.

      • object

        public JSONWriter object()
                  throws JSONException
        Begin appending a new object. All keys and values until the balancing endObject will be appended to this object. The endObject method must be called to mark the object's end.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If the nesting is too deep, or if the object is started in the wrong place (for example as a key or after the end of the outermost array or object).

      • value

        public JSONWriter value(java.lang.Object object)
                 throws JSONException
        Append an object value.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to appendString. It can be null, or a Boolean, Number, String, JSONObject, or JSONArray, or an object that implements JSONString.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If the value is out of sequence.

      • values

        public JSONWriter values(java.lang.Iterable<?> values)
                  throws JSONException
        Append a sequence of values into an array.
        Parameters:
        values - The objects to appendString. They can be null, or a Boolean, Number, String, JSONObject, or JSONArray, or an object that implements JSONString.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If a value is out of place. For example, a value occurs where a key is expected.

      • entries

        public JSONWriter entries(java.util.Map<?,?> kvPairs)
                   throws JSONException
        Append a sequence of keys and values in an object. The key will be associated with the corresponding value. In an object, every value must be associated with a key.
        Parameters:
        kvPairs - The objects to appendString. The values can be null, or a Boolean, Number, String, JSONObject, or JSONArray, or an object that implements JSONString.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        JSONException - If a key or value is out of place. For example, keys do not belong in arrays or if the key is null.

        static <T extends java.lang.Appendable> T writeValue(java.lang.Object value,
                                                     T writer)
                                              throws JSONException
        Write the contents of the Object as JSON text to a writer. For compactness, no whitespace is added.

        Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

        Parameters:

        writer - Writes the serialized JSON
        Returns:
        The writer.
        Throws:
        JSONException - there was a problem writing the Object

      • writeString

        static <T extends java.lang.Appendable> T writeString(java.lang.CharSequence string,
                                                      T w)
                                               throws JSONException
        Produce a string in double quotes with backslash sequences in all the right places. A backslash will be inserted within </, producing <\/, allowing JSON text to be delivered in HTML. In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an unescaped quote or backslash.
        Type Parameters:
        T - A subtype of Appendable, returned to the caller for chaining purposes
        Parameters:
        string - A character sequence to be quoted
        w - the Appendable to which the quoted character sequence will be written
        Returns:
        A String correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
        Throws:
        JSONException - there was a problem writing to the Appendable
